creator: Franck RICHARD
descriptionHtml:
(Minimum recommended configuration: Android 6.0 with 1.5 GB of Ram minimum and openGL ES 3.0. The software contains no ads.)

WinStars 3 is a planetarium for almost any platform. Employing 3D technology to display our solar system in a realistic manner, users may tour the planets, follow a space probe on its long voyage, or observe a celestial event from a distant world, as well as receiving the latest astrophysical news from a live feed.

Updates add new features and functionality, transforming it into an advanced educational tool for discovering our Universe.

Main features:

- Gaia DR2 catalogue with more than 1.7 billion stars (internet connection needed).
- More than 30,000 galaxies, nebulae, star clusters (OpenNGC + EDD Catalogues).
- A direction of observation which is easily controlled by a mouse and in real time.
- A precise representation of the observable sky from a point on the earth’s surface on a given date.
- A 3D interface to give more realism to celestial objects.
- Virtual textures to display high resolution surface details of planets.
- Travel throughout the solar system, to over 200,000 stars, the edge of our galaxy and beyond.
- Follows the latest scientific news by downloading additional modules.
- A calculation of notable astronomical phenomena visible from an observation point on the earth.
- Detailed information about each object.
- A calculation of the positions of the principal satellites of Mars, Jupiter, Saturn, Uranus and Neptune, of comets and of asteroids.
- An outline of the celestial equator, the ecliptic, and a grid of azimuthal and equatorial coordinates.
- A 3D outline of the planetary orbits.
- drives a large range of telescopes.
- Internet resources are also available:
updated comets and asteroids’ elements, querying of DSS (Digitized Sky Survey) servers to obtain a photograph of that portion of the sky being displayed by the program, a notice of the visibility of artificial satellites, etc.
- Automatic modules updates.
- Available languages: english, french, german, spanish, russian.


By purchasing the full version of WinStars 3 (3.99€), you will be able to access all the functions of the software, and in particular :

- Access to the entire catalogue Gaia DR2.
- a digital version of a photographic atlas covering the entire sky (Digitized Sky Survey function).
- high-resolution textures of the Moon, Mars and Earth,
- additional modules (3D models, additional catalogues, scientific news...)

Documentation : https://winstars.net/docs/en

Visit https://winstars.net/en for more information about the software, access to forums and suggest new features.
descriptionShort: The whole universe in your pocket !

appDetails.recentChangesHtml:
- Various improvements
- Adjusts the display with the orientation of the mobile phone
- Better stability
- Geologic map of the Moon (US Geological Survey).
- Improved orbits representation.
- Interface improvement.
- Integration of the DE438 planetary model from the Jet Propulsion Laboratory.
- Refactoring of the source code.
- Displaying the Starlink megaconstellation.
- New "Search" dialog box
- Improved video mode.

- The interface and 3d visualization now work at the same speed. By clicking on a window and moving it to the left, it is now possible to close it.
- Faster rendering
- Various improvements
- Adjusts the display with the orientation of the mobile phone
- Better stability
- Geologic map of the Moon (US Geological Survey).
- Improved orbits representation.
- Interface improvement.
- Integration of the DE438 planetary model from the Jet Propulsion Laboratory.

title: WinStars 3 - Astronomy

creator: Belacqua labo
descriptionHtml:
DUE TO A BUG IN THE LATEST VERSION OF THE QT LIBRARY, THE PROGRAM MAY CRASH ON HUAWEI MOBILES RUNNING ANDROID 9 AND 10..

(Minimum recommended configuration: Android 6.0 with 1.5 GB of Ram minimum and openGL ES 3.0. The software contains no ads.)

WinStars 3 is a planetarium for almost any platform. Employing 3D technology to display our solar system in a realistic manner, users may tour the planets, follow a space probe on its long voyage, or observe a celestial event from a distant world, as well as receiving the latest astrophysical news from a live feed.

Updates add new features and functionality, transforming it into an advanced educational tool for discovering our Universe.

Main features:

- Gaia DR2 catalogue with more than 1.7 billion stars (internet connection needed).
- More than 30,000 galaxies, nebulae, star clusters (OpenNGC + EDD Catalogues).
- A direction of observation which is easily controlled by a mouse and in real time.
- A precise representation of the observable sky from a point on the earth’s surface on a given date.
- A 3D interface to give more realism to celestial objects.
- Virtual textures to display high resolution surface details of planets.
- Travel throughout the solar system, to over 200,000 stars, the edge of our galaxy and beyond.
- Follows the latest scientific news by downloading additional modules.
- A calculation of notable astronomical phenomena visible from an observation point on the earth.
- Detailed information about each object.
- A calculation of the positions of the principal satellites of Mars, Jupiter, Saturn, Uranus and Neptune, of comets and of asteroids.
- An outline of the celestial equator, the ecliptic, and a grid of azimuthal and equatorial coordinates.
- A 3D outline of the planetary orbits.
- drives a large range of telescopes.
- Internet resources are also available:
updated comets and asteroids’ elements, querying of DSS (Digitized Sky Survey) servers to obtain a photograph of that portion of the sky being displayed by the program, a notice of the visibility of artificial satellites, etc.
- Automatic modules updates.
- Available languages: english, french, german, spanish, russian.


By purchasing the full version of WinStars 3 (3.99€), you will be able to access all the functions of the software, and in particular :

- Access to the entire catalogue Gaia DR2.
- a digital version of a photographic atlas covering the entire sky (Digitized Sky Survey function).
- high-resolution textures of the Moon, Mars and Earth,
- additional modules (3D models, additional catalogues, scientific news...)

Documentation : https://winstars.net/docs/en

Visit https://winstars.net/en for more information about the software, access to forums and suggest new features.
descriptionShort: The whole universe in your pocket !

appDetails.recentChangesHtml:
- Planetarium mode: corrects many defects that appear when using a high magnification (imprecise pointer coordinates, misalignment of DSS plates, difficulties in selecting an object).
- Planetarium mode: the Moon is represented with better resolution if textures are available.
- Planetarium mode: the planet surface is rendered faster.

title: WinStars 3 - Astronomy

creator: Belacqua labo
descriptionHtml:
DUE TO A BUG IN THE LATEST VERSION OF THE QT LIBRARY, THE PROGRAM MAY CRASH ON HUAWEI MOBILES RUNNING ANDROID 9 AND 10..

(Minimum recommended configuration: Android 6.0 with 1.5 GB of Ram minimum and openGL ES 3.0.)

WinStars is a planetarium running on computers, tablets and mobiles. It is a 3D simulator that accurately represents celestial objects at a given time. It also allows you to travel in our galaxy and its close neighbourhood. A thread dedicated to scientific news allows you to follow and display in the software the results of research currently conducted in astrophysics. New functions will be progressively added in order to convert the software into a pedagogical tool dedicated to the discovery of our Universe.

Main features:

- Visualise the sky as it was 500 years ago or as it will be in 10,000 years!
- Discover the names of the main stars or locate the constellations by moving your mobile. WinStars will help you to identify the objects you are pointing at.
- Are you looking for an object? Just type its name and let the software guide you.
- Is Messier 31 observable tonight? Simply click on the galaxy and display its identity sheet. You will find details on its visibility (rise and set times).
- The software includes a huge database of billions of objects.
- Each object has a detailed card which is updated in real time (distances, right ascension, declination, azimuth, altitude and magnitude).
- It is possible to follow the trajectory of all the satellites in orbit around the Earth and anticipate, for example, the passage of the International Space Station (ISS) over your head.
- Represents with precision the position of the main satellites of Mars, Jupiter, Saturn, Uranus and Neptune. All you need to do is zooming in sufficiently on the main planet.
- Also calculates the position of hundreds of thousands of additional objects in our solar system (comets and asteroids).
- Indicates the significant astronomical phenomenons visible from your observation location.
- Plots the celestial equator, the ecliptic, the azimuthal and equatorial coordinate grids.
- Represents the orbits of the planets in 3D.
- Easy installation of additional modules.
- Automated software updates.
- Customisable landscapes.
- Available languages: English, French, German, Russian, Spanish, Russian, German

The free version offers most of the functions available, but the acquisition of a licence provides an additional enhancement to the software:

- Add the Gaia DR2 catalogue containing 1.7 billion stars… up to the magnitude 22! (internet connection required).
- Explore the stars close to our Sun.
- Leave the Milky Way and visit other galaxies. Discover the large-scale structures of our Universe.
- Planetary rendering surfaces in 3D with improved textures.
- Displays the DSS (Digitized Sky Survey) digitized sky in various wavelengths.
- Add interplanetary missions.

WinStars is in constant evolution. Do you have a suggestion or have you found an error ?
Send me a message to franck.richard@winstars.net
Errors are often corrected in an hour!

Documentation : https://winstars.net/docs/en

Visit https://winstars.net/en for more information about the software.
descriptionShort: The whole universe in your pocket !

appDetails.recentChangesHtml:
- The labels of the objects no longer overlap.
- Fixed a flickering window problem in portrait mode.
- Introduction of a new option to reduce the amount of text displayed on the starry sky. This option is useful for small configurations (phones, tablets).
- Planetarium mode: corrects many defects that appear when using a high magnification.

descriptionShort: The whole universe in your pocket !

appDetails.recentChangesHtml:
- The labels of the objects no longer overlap.
- Fixed a flickering window problem in portrait mode.
- Introduction of a new option to reduce the amount of text displayed on the starry sky. This option is useful for small configurations (phones, tablets).
- Planetarium mode: corrects many defects that appear when using a high magnification.

title: WinStars 3 - Astronomy

creator: Belacqua labo
descriptionHtml:
DUE TO A BUG IN THE LATEST VERSION OF THE QT LIBRARY, THE PROGRAM MAY CRASH ON HUAWEI MOBILES RUNNING ANDROID 9 AND 10..

(Minimum recommended configuration: Android 6.0 with 1.5 GB of Ram minimum and openGL ES 3.0.)

WinStars is a planetarium running on computers, tablets and mobiles. It is a 3D simulator that accurately represents celestial objects at a given time. It also allows you to travel in our galaxy and its close neighbourhood. A thread dedicated to scientific news allows you to follow and display in the software the results of research currently conducted in astrophysics. New functions will be progressively added in order to convert the software into a pedagogical tool dedicated to the discovery of our Universe.

Main features:

- Visualise the sky as it was 500 years ago or as it will be in 10,000 years!
- Discover the names of the main stars or locate the constellations by moving your mobile. WinStars will help you to identify the objects you are pointing at.
- Are you looking for an object? Just type its name and let the software guide you.
- Is Messier 31 observable tonight? Simply click on the galaxy and display its identity sheet. You will find details on its visibility (rise and set times).
- The software includes a huge database of billions of objects.
- Each object has a detailed card which is updated in real time (distances, right ascension, declination, azimuth, altitude and magnitude).
- It is possible to follow the trajectory of all the satellites in orbit around the Earth and anticipate, for example, the passage of the International Space Station (ISS) over your head.
- Represents with precision the position of the main satellites of Mars, Jupiter, Saturn, Uranus and Neptune. All you need to do is zooming in sufficiently on the main planet.
- Also calculates the position of hundreds of thousands of additional objects in our solar system (comets and asteroids).
- Indicates the significant astronomical phenomenons visible from your observation location.
- Plots the celestial equator, the ecliptic, the azimuthal and equatorial coordinate grids.
- Represents the orbits of the planets in 3D.
- Easy installation of additional modules.
- Automated software updates.
- Customisable landscapes.
- Available languages: English, French, German, Russian, Spanish, Russian, German

The free version offers most of the functions available, but the acquisition of a licence provides an additional enhancement to the software:

- Add the Gaia DR2 catalogue containing 1.7 billion stars… up to the magnitude 22! (internet connection required).
- Explore the stars close to our Sun.
- Leave the Milky Way and visit other galaxies. Discover the large-scale structures of our Universe.
- Planetary rendering surfaces in 3D with improved textures.
- Displays the DSS (Digitized Sky Survey) digitized sky in various wavelengths.
- Add interplanetary missions.

WinStars is in constant evolution. Do you have a suggestion or have you found an error ?
Send me a message to franck.richard@winstars.net
Errors are often corrected in an hour!

Documentation : https://winstars.net/docs/en

Visit https://winstars.net/en for more information about the software.

(Minimum recommended configuration: Android 6.0 with 1.5 GB of Ram minimum and openGL ES 3.0.)

WinStars is a planetarium running on computers, tablets and mobiles. It is a 3D simulator that accurately represents celestial objects at a given time. It also allows you to travel in our galaxy and its close neighbourhood. A thread dedicated to scientific news allows you to follow and display in the software the results of research currently conducted in astrophysics. New functions will be progressively added in order to convert the software into a pedagogical tool dedicated to the discovery of our Universe.

Main features:

- Visualise the sky as it was 500 years ago or as it will be in 10,000 years!
- Discover the names of the main stars or locate the constellations by moving your mobile. WinStars will help you to identify the objects you are pointing at.
- Are you looking for an object? Just type its name and let the software guide you.
- Is Messier 31 observable tonight? Simply click on the galaxy and display its identity sheet. You will find details on its visibility (rise and set times).
- The software includes a huge database of billions of objects.
- Each object has a detailed card which is updated in real time (distances, right ascension, declination, azimuth, altitude and magnitude).
- It is possible to follow the trajectory of all the satellites in orbit around the Earth and anticipate, for example, the passage of the International Space Station (ISS) over your head.
- Represents with precision the position of the main satellites of Mars, Jupiter, Saturn, Uranus and Neptune. All you need to do is zooming in sufficiently on the main planet.
- Also calculates the position of hundreds of thousands of additional objects in our solar system (comets and asteroids).
- Indicates the significant astronomical phenomenons visible from your observation location.
- Plots the celestial equator, the ecliptic, the azimuthal and equatorial coordinate grids.
- Represents the orbits of the planets in 3D.
- Easy installation of additional modules.
- Automated software updates.
- Customisable landscapes.
- Available languages: English, French, German, Russian, Spanish.

The free version offers most of the functions available, but the acquisition of a licence provides an additional enhancement to the software:

- Add the Gaia DR2 catalogue containing 1.7 billion stars… up to the magnitude 22! (internet connection required).
- Explore the stars close to our Sun.
- Leave the Milky Way and visit other galaxies. Discover the large-scale structures of our Universe.
- Planetary rendering surfaces in 3D with improved textures.
- Displays the DSS (Digitized Sky Survey) digitized sky in various wavelengths.
- Add interplanetary missions.

WinStars is in constant evolution. Do you have a suggestion or have you found an error ?
Send me a message to franck.richard@winstars.net
Errors are often corrected in an hour!

Documentation : https://winstars.net/docs/en

Visit https://winstars.net/en for more information about the software.
descriptionShort: The whole universe in your pocket !

appDetails.recentChangesHtml:
- Integration of users' suggestions.
- Implementation of an astronomy education module (under development)
- Asteroids and comets will gradually be represented with their real form.
- Correction of defects in the interface.
- The labels of the objects no longer overlap.
- Fixed a flickering window problem in portrait mode.

- Indicates the significant astronomical phenomenons visible from your observation location.
- Plots the celestial equator, the ecliptic, the azimuthal and equatorial coordinate grids.
- Represents the orbits of the planets in 3D.
- Easy installation of additional modules.
- Automated software updates.
- Customisable landscapes.
- Available languages: English, French, German, Russian, Spanish.

The free version offers most of the functions available, but the acquisition of a licence provides an additional enhancement to the software:

- Add the Gaia DR2 catalogue containing 1.7 billion stars… up to the magnitude 22! (internet connection required).
- Explore the stars close to our Sun.
- Leave the Milky Way and visit other galaxies. Discover the large-scale structures of our Universe.
- Planetary rendering surfaces in 3D with improved textures.
- Displays the DSS (Digitized Sky Survey) digitized sky in various wavelengths.
- Add interplanetary missions.

WinStars is in constant evolution. Do you have a suggestion or have you found an error ?
Send me a message to franck.richard@winstars.net
Errors are often corrected in an hour!

- Are you looking for an object? Just type its name and let the software guide you.
- Is Messier 31 observable tonight? Simply click on the galaxy and display its identity sheet. You will find details on its visibility (rise and set times).

- Each object has a detailed card which is updated in real time (distances, right ascension, declination, azimuth, altitude and magnitude).

descriptionShort: The whole universe in your pocket !

appDetails.recentChangesHtml:
- It is now possible to select an object by keeping a long press on it.
- Improved 3D visualisation of the stars when moving among them.
- Very significant improvement of graphics performance. W3 now works on the smallest Android devices.
- Improvement of the Search box (you can now type a name without accents).
- What is the origin of the names of the stars? (learning module)
- A new feature "Tonight" has been added (under development)

title: WinStars 3 - Astronomy

creator: Franck RICHARD
descriptionHtml:
(Minimum recommended configuration: Android 6.0 with 1.5 GB of Ram minimum and openGL ES 3.0.
WinStars 3 is sophisticated software. It is recommended to consult the documentation available at this address: https://winstars.net/docs/en/)

WinStars is a planetarium running on computers, tablets and mobiles. It is a 3D simulator that accurately represents celestial objects at a given time. It also allows you to travel in our galaxy and its close neighbourhood. A thread dedicated to scientific news allows you to follow and display in the software the results of research currently conducted in astrophysics. New functions will be progressively added in order to convert the software into a pedagogical tool dedicated to the discovery of our Universe.

Main features:

- Visualise the sky as it was 500 years ago or as it will be in 10,000 years!
- Discover the names of the main stars or locate the constellations by moving your mobile. WinStars will help you to identify the objects you are pointing at.
- Are you looking for an object? Just type its name and let the software guide you.
- Is Messier 31 observable tonight? Simply click on the galaxy and display its identity sheet. You will find details on its visibility (rise and set times).
- The software includes a huge database of billions of objects.
- Each object has a detailed card which is updated in real time (distances, right ascension, declination, azimuth, altitude and magnitude).
- It is possible to follow the trajectory of all the satellites in orbit around the Earth and anticipate, for example, the passage of the International Space Station (ISS) over your head.
- Represents with precision the position of the main satellites of Mars, Jupiter, Saturn, Uranus and Neptune. All you need to do is zooming in sufficiently on the main planet.
- Also calculates the position of hundreds of thousands of additional objects in our solar system (comets and asteroids).
- Indicates the significant astronomical phenomenons visible from your observation location.
- Plots the celestial equator, the ecliptic, the azimuthal and equatorial coordinate grids.
- Represents the orbits of the planets in 3D.
- Easy installation of additional modules.
- Automated software updates.
- Customisable landscapes.
- Available languages: English, French, German, Russian, Spanish.

The free version offers most of the functions available, but the acquisition of a licence provides an additional enhancement to the software:

- Add the Gaia DR2 catalogue containing 1.7 billion stars… up to the magnitude 22! (internet connection required).
- Explore the stars close to our Sun.
- Leave the Milky Way and visit other galaxies. Discover the large-scale structures of our Universe.
- Planetary rendering surfaces in 3D with improved textures.
- Displays the DSS (Digitized Sky Survey) digitized sky in various wavelengths.
- Add interplanetary missions.

WinStars is in constant evolution. Do you have a suggestion or have you found an error ?
Send me a message to franck.richard@winstars.net
Errors are often corrected in an hour!

Documentation : https://winstars.net/docs/en

Visit https://winstars.net/en for more information about the software.
descriptionShort: The whole universe in your pocket !

appDetails.recentChangesHtml:
- Faster text rendering.
- The programme consults a weather site to automatically adjust the pressure and temperature of the observation site.
- Various improvements.

WinStars is always faster and easier to use. If you have any comments or suggestions, I would be happy to hear you: franck.richard@winstars.net

(WinStars 3 is sophisticated software. This is not a game but a tool to help you plan your astronomical observations. It is recommended to consult the documentation available at this address: https://winstars.net/docs/en/)

WinStars is a planetarium running on computers, tablets and mobiles. It is a 3D simulator that accurately represents celestial objects at a given time. It also allows you to travel in our galaxy and its close neighbourhood. A thread dedicated to scientific news allows you to follow and display in the software the results of research currently conducted in astrophysics. WinStars is a software in constant evolution. New functions are regularly added to make it an educational tool dedicated to the discovery of our Universe.

Main features:

- Visualise the sky as it was 500 years ago or as it will be in 10,000 years!
- Discover the names of the main stars or locate the constellations by moving your mobile. WinStars will help you to identify the objects you are pointing at.
- Are you looking for an object? Just type its name and let the software guide you.
- WinStars gives you access to a lot of information about each object.
- The software includes a huge database of billions of objects.
- Each object has a detailed card which is updated in real time (distances, right ascension, declination, azimuth, altitude and magnitude).
- It is possible to track all satellites placed in orbit around the Earth and predict, for example, the times of visibility of the International Space Station (ISS).
- Represents with precision the position of the main satellites of Mars, Jupiter, Saturn, Uranus and Neptune. All you need to do is zooming in sufficiently on the main planet.
- Also calculates the position of hundreds of thousands of additional objects in our solar system (comets and asteroids).
- Track planetary missions (Voyager 2, Pioneer 10, etc.).
- Indicates the significant astronomical phenomenons visible from your observation location.
- Plots the celestial equator, the ecliptic, the azimuthal and equatorial coordinate grids.
- Represents the orbits of the planets in 3D.
- A night mode allowing you to watch the screen in the dark without being dazzled.
- Easy installation of additional modules.
- Automated software updates.
- Customisable landscapes.
- Available languages: bulgarian, english, french, german, russian, spanish

The free version offers most of the functions available, but the acquisition of a licence provides an additional enhancement to the software:

- Add the Gaia EDR3 catalogue containing 1.7 billion stars... up to the magnitude 22 ! (internet connection required).
- Explore the stars close to our Sun.
- Leave the Milky Way and visit other galaxies. Discover the large-scale structures of our Universe.
- Planetary surfaces rendered in 3D with improved textures.
- Displays the DSS (Digitized Sky Survey) digitized sky in various wavelengths.
- Add interplanetary missions.

Documentation : https://winstars.net/docs/en

Visit https://winstars.net/en for more information about the software.
descriptionShort: The whole universe in your pocket !

appDetails.recentChangesHtml:
- New presentation of the dialog boxes.
- New menu system.
- Updated Gaia catalogue (EDR3)
- The programme consults a weather site to automatically adjust the pressure and temperature of the observation site.
- Various improvements.

WinStars is always faster and easier to use. If you have any comments or suggestions, I would be happy to hear you: franck.richard@winstars.net

- Leave the Milky Way and visit other galaxies. Discover the large-scale structures of our Universe.
- Planetary surfaces rendered in 3D with improved textures.
- Displays the DSS (Digitized Sky Survey) digitized sky in various wavelengths.
- Add interplanetary missions.

Documentation : https://winstars.net/docs/en

Visit https://winstars.net/en for more information about the software.

- WinStars gives you access to a lot of information about each object.
- The software includes a huge database of billions of objects.
- Each object has a detailed card which is updated in real time (distances, right ascension, declination, azimuth, altitude and magnitude).
- It is possible to track all satellites placed in orbit around the Earth and predict, for example, the times of visibility of the International Space Station (ISS).

Moreover, the rendering of the sky is as realistic as possible. It is therefore not a question here to represent a sky vault of video games. It is recommended to consult the documentation available at this address: https://winstars.net/docs/en

Main features:

- Visualise the sky as it was 500 years ago or as it will be in 10,000 years!
- Discover the names of the main stars or locate the constellations by moving your mobile. WinStars will help you to identify the objects you are pointing at.
- Are you looking for an object? Just type its name and let the software guide you.
- WinStars gives you access to a lot of information about each object.
- The software includes a huge database of billions of objects.
- Each object has a detailed card which is updated in real time (distances, right ascension, declination, azimuth, altitude and magnitude).
- It is possible to track all satellites placed in orbit around the Earth and predict, for example, the times of visibility of the International Space Station (ISS).
- Represents with precision the position of the main satellites of Mars, Jupiter, Saturn, Uranus and Neptune. All you need to do is zooming in sufficiently on the main planet.
- Also calculates the position of hundreds of thousands of additional objects in our solar system (comets and asteroids).
- Track planetary missions (Voyager 2, Pioneer 10, etc.).
- Indicates the significant astronomical phenomenons visible from your observation location.
- Plots the celestial equator, the ecliptic, the azimuthal and equatorial coordinate grids.
- Represents the orbits of the planets in 3D.
- A night mode allowing you to watch the screen in the dark without being dazzled.
- Easy installation of additional modules.
- Automated software updates.
- Customisable landscapes.
- Available languages: bulgarian, english, french, german, russian, spanish

The free version offers most of the functions available, but the acquisition of a licence provides an additional enhancement to the software:

- Add the Gaia EDR3 catalogue containing 1.7 billion stars... up to the magnitude 22 ! (internet connection required).
- Explore the stars close to our Sun.
- Leave the Milky Way and visit other galaxies. Discover the large-scale structures of our Universe.
- Planetary surfaces rendered in 3D with improved textures.
- Displays the DSS (Digitized Sky Survey) digitized sky in various wavelengths.
- Add interplanetary missions.

Documentation : https://winstars.net/docs/en

Visit https://winstars.net/en for more information about the software.

- Displays the DSS (Digitized Sky Survey) digitized sky in various wavelengths.
- Add interplanetary missions.

descriptionHtml:

WinStars is a planetarium running on computers, tablets and mobiles. It is a 3D simulator that accurately represents celestial objects at a given time. A thread dedicated to scientific news allows you to follow and display in the software the results of research currently conducted in astrophysics. WinStars is a software in constant evolution. New functions are regularly added to make it an educational tool dedicated to the discovery of our Universe.

WinStars 3 is a sophisticated software. It offers much more functionalities than the software of its category. It is a tool that will help you to plan your astronomical observations and discover the universe. I made the choice to make it very customizable and to allow you to act in depth on its functioning. Moreover, the rendering of the sky is as realistic as possible. It is therefore not a question here to represent a sky vault of video games. It is recommended to consult the documentation available at this address: https://winstars.net/docs/en

Main features:

- Visualise the sky as it was 500 years ago or as it will be in 10,000 years!
- Discover the names of the main stars or locate the constellations by moving your mobile. WinStars will help you to identify the objects you are pointing at.
- Are you looking for an object? Just type its name and let the software guide you.
- WinStars gives you access to a lot of information about each object.
- The software includes a huge database of billions of objects.
- Each object has a detailed card which is updated in real time (distances, right ascension, declination, azimuth, altitude and magnitude).
- It is possible to track all satellites placed in orbit around the Earth and predict, for example, the times of visibility of the International Space Station (ISS).
- Represents with precision the position of the main satellites of Mars, Jupiter, Saturn, Uranus and Neptune. All you need to do is zooming in sufficiently on the main planet.
- Also calculates the position of hundreds of thousands of additional objects in our solar system (comets and asteroids).
- Track planetary missions (Voyager 2, Pioneer 10, etc.).
- Indicates the significant astronomical phenomenons visible from your observation location.
- Plots the celestial equator, the ecliptic, the azimuthal and equatorial coordinate grids.
- Represents the orbits of the planets in 3D.
- A night mode allowing you to watch the screen in the dark without being dazzled.
- Easy installation of additional modules.
- Automated software updates.
- Customisable landscapes.
- Available languages: bulgarian, english, french, german, russian, spanish

- Leave the Milky Way and visit other galaxies. Discover the large-scale structures of our Universe.

- Add interplanetary missions.

- Discover the names of the main stars or locate the constellations by moving your mobile. WinStars will help you to identify the objects you are pointing at.
- Are you looking for an object? Just type its name and let the software guide you.
- WinStars gives you access to a lot of information about each object.
- The software includes a huge database of billions of objects.
- Each object has a detailed card which is updated in real time (distances, right ascension, declination, azimuth, altitude and magnitude).
- It is possible to track all satellites placed in orbit around the Earth and predict, for example, the times of visibility of the International Space Station (ISS).
- Represents with precision the position of the main satellites of Mars, Jupiter, Saturn, Uranus and Neptune. All you need to do is zooming in sufficiently on the main planet.
- Also calculates the position of hundreds of thousands of additional objects in our solar system (comets and asteroids).
- Track planetary missions (Voyager 2, Pioneer 10, etc.).
- Indicates the significant astronomical phenomenons visible from your observation location.
- Plots the celestial equator, the ecliptic, the azimuthal and equatorial coordinate grids.
- Represents the orbits of the planets in 3D.
- A night mode allowing you to watch the screen in the dark without being dazzled.
- Easy installation of additional modules.
- Automated software updates.
- Customisable landscapes.
- Available languages: bulgarian, english, french, german, russian, spanish

The free version offers most of the functions available, but the acquisition of a licence provides an additional enhancement to the software:

- Add the Gaia EDR3 catalogue containing 1.7 billion stars... up to the magnitude 22 ! (internet connection required).
- Explore the stars close to our Sun.
- Leave the Milky Way and visit other galaxies. Discover the large-scale structures of our Universe.
- Planetary surfaces rendered in 3D with improved textures.
- Displays the DSS (Digitized Sky Survey) digitized sky in various wavelengths.
- Add interplanetary missions.

Documentation : https://winstars.net/docs/en

Visit https://winstars.net/en for more information about the software.
descriptionShort: The whole universe in your pocket !

appDetails.recentChangesHtml:
- In the paid version, asteroids and comets are represented individually in 3D using different methods: space imagery, radar imagery or light curves (limited to identification numbers < 100 for the moment).
- More efficient zooming
- Fewer permissions needed to install W3

WinStars is always faster and easier to use. If you have any comments or suggestions, I would be happy to hear you: franck.richard@winstars.net

creator: Franck RICHARD
descriptionHtml:
WinStars is a planetarium running on computers, tablets and mobiles. It is a 3D simulator that accurately represents celestial objects at a given time. It also allows you to travel in our galaxy and its close neighbourhood. A thread dedicated to scientific news allows you to follow and display in the software the results of research currently conducted in astrophysics. WinStars is a software in constant evolution. New functions are regularly added to make it an educational tool dedicated to the discovery of our Universe.

It is recommended to consult the documentation available at this address: https://winstars.net/docs/en

Main features:

- Visualise the sky as it was 500 years ago or as it will be in 10,000 years!
- Discover the names of the main stars or locate the constellations by moving your mobile. WinStars will help you to identify the objects you are pointing at.
- Are you looking for an object? Just type its name and let the software guide you.
- WinStars gives you access to a lot of information about each object.
- The software includes a huge database of billions of objects.
- Each object has a detailed card which is updated in real time (distances, right ascension, declination, azimuth, altitude and magnitude).
- It is possible to track all satellites placed in orbit around the Earth and predict, for example, the times of visibility of the International Space Station (ISS).
- Represents with precision the position of the main satellites of Mars, Jupiter, Saturn, Uranus and Neptune. All you need to do is zooming in sufficiently on the main planet.
- Also calculates the position of hundreds of thousands of additional objects in our solar system (comets and asteroids).
- Track planetary missions (Voyager 2, Pioneer 10, etc.).
- Indicates the significant astronomical phenomenons visible from your observation location.
- Plots the celestial equator, the ecliptic, the azimuthal and equatorial coordinate grids.
- Represents the orbits of the planets in 3D.
- A night mode allowing you to watch the screen in the dark without being dazzled.
- Easy installation of additional modules.
- Automated software updates.
- Customisable landscapes.
- Available languages: bulgarian, english, french, german, russian, spanish

The free version offers most of the functions available, but the acquisition of a licence provides an additional enhancement to the software:

- Add the Gaia EDR3 catalogue containing 1.7 billion stars... up to the magnitude 22 ! (internet connection required).
- Explore the stars close to our Sun.
- Leave the Milky Way and visit other galaxies. Discover the large-scale structures of our Universe.
- Planetary surfaces rendered in 3D with improved textures (please note that your device must be compatible with the OpenGL es 3.2 standard or higher).
- Many comets and asteroids appear in the software in their true shape.
- Displays the DSS (Digitized Sky Survey) digitized sky in various wavelengths.
- Add interplanetary missions.

Visit https://winstars.net/en for more information about the software.
descriptionShort: The whole universe in your pocket !

WinStars is always faster and easier to use. If you have any comments or suggestions, I would be happy to hear you: franck.richard@winstars.net

- Add the Gaia EDR3 catalogue containing 1.7 billion stars... up to the magnitude 22 ! (internet connection required).
- Explore the stars close to our Sun.
- Leave the Milky Way and visit other galaxies. Discover the large-scale structures of our Universe.
- Planetary surfaces rendered in 3D with improved textures (please note that your device must be compatible with the OpenGL es 3.2 standard or higher).
- Many comets and asteroids appear in the software in their true shape.
- Displays the DSS (Digitized Sky Survey) digitized sky in various wavelengths.
- Add interplanetary missions.

Visit https://winstars.net/en for more information about the software.
descriptionShort: The whole universe in your pocket !

appDetails.recentChangesHtml:
- Add JWST (available after launch), TESS and Kepler missions.
All revisions : https://winstars.net/en/changelog

WinStars is always faster and easier to use. If you have any comments or suggestions, I would be happy to hear you: franck.richard@winstars.net

title: WinStars 3 - Astronomy

creator: Franck RICHARD
descriptionHtml:
WinStars is a planetarium running on computers, tablets and mobiles. It is a 3D simulator that accurately represents celestial objects at a given time. It also allows you to travel in our galaxy and its close neighbourhood. A thread dedicated to scientific news allows you to follow and display in the software the results of research currently conducted in astrophysics. WinStars is a software in constant evolution. New functions are regularly added to make it an educational tool dedicated to the discovery of our Universe.The full version costs 3,99 EUR and gives access to all the features.

It is recommended to consult the documentation available at this address: https://winstars.net/docs/en

Main features:

- Visualise the sky as it was 500 years ago or as it will be in 10,000 years!
- Discover the names of the main stars or locate the constellations by moving your mobile. WinStars will help you to identify the objects you are pointing at.
- Are you looking for an object? Just type its name and let the software guide you.
- WinStars gives you access to a lot of information about each object.
- The software includes a huge database of billions of objects.
- Each object has a detailed card which is updated in real time (distances, right ascension, declination, azimuth, altitude and magnitude).
- It is possible to track all satellites placed in orbit around the Earth and predict, for example, the times of visibility of the International Space Station (ISS).
- Represents with precision the position of the main satellites of Mars, Jupiter, Saturn, Uranus and Neptune. All you need to do is zooming in sufficiently on the main planet.
- Also calculates the position of hundreds of thousands of additional objects in our solar system (comets and asteroids).
- Track planetary missions (Voyager 2, Pioneer 10, etc.).
- Indicates the significant astronomical phenomenons visible from your observation location.
- Plots the celestial equator, the ecliptic, the azimuthal and equatorial coordinate grids.
- Represents the orbits of the planets in 3D.
- A night mode allowing you to watch the screen in the dark without being dazzled.
- Easy installation of additional modules.
- Automated software updates.
- Customisable landscapes.
- Available languages: bulgarian, english, french, german, russian, spanish

The free version offers most of the functions available, but the acquisition of a licence provides an additional enhancement to the software:

- Add the Gaia EDR3 catalogue containing 1.7 billion stars... up to the magnitude 22 ! (internet connection required).
- Explore the stars close to our Sun.
- Leave the Milky Way and visit other galaxies. Discover the large-scale structures of our Universe.
- Planetary surfaces rendered in 3D with improved textures (please note that your device must be compatible with the OpenGL es 3.2 standard or higher).
- Many comets and asteroids appear in the software in their true shape.
- Displays the DSS (Digitized Sky Survey) digitized sky in various wavelengths.
- Add interplanetary missions.

Visit https://winstars.net/en for more information about the software.

- Mejora de la precisión de las posiciones de los satélites de Marte, Júpiter, Saturno y Urano.
- Incorporación de los pequeños satélites Calypso, Helena y Telesto alrededor de Saturno.
- Optimization of the program.
- Improvement of the camera movements.
All revisions : https://winstars.net/en/changelog

WinStars is always faster and easier to use. If you have any comments or suggestions, I would be happy to hear you: franck.richard@winstars.net

title: WinStars 3 - Astronomy

creator: Franck RICHARD
descriptionHtml:
WinStars is a planetarium running on computers, tablets and mobiles. It is a 3D simulator that accurately represents celestial objects at a given time. It also allows you to travel in our galaxy and its close neighbourhood. A thread dedicated to scientific news allows you to follow and display in the software the results of research currently conducted in astrophysics. WinStars is a software in constant evolution. New functions are regularly added to make it an educational tool dedicated to the discovery of our Universe.The full version costs 3,99 EUR and gives access to all the features.

It is recommended to consult the documentation available at this address: https://winstars.net/docs/en

Main features:

- Visualise the sky as it was 500 years ago or as it will be in 10,000 years!
- Discover the names of the main stars or locate the constellations by moving your mobile. WinStars will help you to identify the objects you are pointing at.
- Are you looking for an object? Just type its name and let the software guide you.
- WinStars gives you access to a lot of information about each object.
- The software includes a huge database of billions of objects.
- Each object has a detailed card which is updated in real time (distances, right ascension, declination, azimuth, altitude and magnitude).
- It is possible to track all satellites placed in orbit around the Earth and predict, for example, the times of visibility of the International Space Station (ISS).
- Represents with precision the position of the main satellites of Mars, Jupiter, Saturn, Uranus and Neptune. All you need to do is zooming in sufficiently on the main planet.
- Also calculates the position of hundreds of thousands of additional objects in our solar system (comets and asteroids).
- Track planetary missions (Voyager 2, Pioneer 10, etc.).
- Indicates the significant astronomical phenomenons visible from your observation location.
- Plots the celestial equator, the ecliptic, the azimuthal and equatorial coordinate grids.
- Represents the orbits of the planets in 3D.
- A night mode allowing you to watch the screen in the dark without being dazzled.
- Easy installation of additional modules.
- Automated software updates.
- Customisable landscapes.
- Available languages: bulgarian, english, french, german, russian, spanish

The free version offers most of the functions available, but the acquisition of a licence provides an additional enhancement to the software:

- Add the Gaia EDR3 catalogue containing 1.7 billion stars... up to the magnitude 22 ! (internet connection required).
- Explore the stars close to our Sun.
- Leave the Milky Way and visit other galaxies. Discover the large-scale structures of our Universe.
- Planetary surfaces rendered in 3D with improved textures (please note that your device must be compatible with the OpenGL es 3.2 standard or higher).
- Many comets and asteroids appear in the software in their true shape.
- Displays the DSS (Digitized Sky Survey) digitized sky in various wavelengths.
- Add interplanetary missions.

Visit https://winstars.net/en for more information about the software.
descriptionShort: The whole universe in your pocket !

appDetails.recentChangesHtml:
- Significant improvement of the DSS (Digitized Sky Survey) function.
- Creation of a cache server to speed up the downloading of DSS images and stars from the Gaia EDR3 catalog.

All revisions : https://winstars.net/en/changelog

WinStars is always faster and easier to use. If you have any comments or suggestions, I would be happy to hear you: franck.richard@winstars.net

New functions are regularly added to make it an educational tool dedicated to the discovery of our Universe.The full version costs 3,99 EUR and gives access to all the features.

It is recommended to consult the documentation available at this address: https://winstars.net/docs/en

Main features:

- Visualise the sky as it was 500 years ago or as it will be in 10,000 years!
- Discover the names of the main stars or locate the constellations by moving your mobile. WinStars will help you to identify the objects you are pointing at.
- Are you looking for an object? Just type its name and let the software guide you.
- WinStars gives you access to a lot of information about each object.
- The software includes a huge database of billions of objects.
- Each object has a detailed card which is updated in real time (distances, right ascension, declination, azimuth, altitude and magnitude).
- It is possible to track all satellites placed in orbit around the Earth and predict, for example, the times of visibility of the International Space Station (ISS).
- Represents with precision the position of the main satellites of Mars, Jupiter, Saturn, Uranus and Neptune. All you need to do is zooming in sufficiently on the main planet.
- Also calculates the position of hundreds of thousands of additional objects in our solar system (comets and asteroids).
- Track planetary missions (Voyager 2, Pioneer 10, etc.).
- Indicates the significant astronomical phenomenons visible from your observation location.
- Plots the celestial equator, the ecliptic, the azimuthal and equatorial coordinate grids.
- Represents the orbits of the planets in 3D.
- A night mode allowing you to watch the screen in the dark without being dazzled.
- Easy installation of additional modules.
- Automated software updates.
- Customisable landscapes.
- Available languages: bulgarian, english, french, german, russian, spanish

The free version offers most of the functions available, but the acquisition of a licence provides an additional enhancement to the software:

- Add the Gaia EDR3 catalogue containing 1.7 billion stars... up to the magnitude 22 ! (internet connection required).
- Add many deep sky objects (more than 100000 galaxies, nebulae, clusters, pulsars, quasars)
- Explore the stars close to our Sun.
- Leave the Milky Way and visit other galaxies. Discover the large-scale structures of our Universe.
- Planetary surfaces rendered in 3D with improved textures. Fly over mountains and lunar craters or walk on the surface of the Earth, Moon or Mars ! Please note that your device must be compatible with OpenGL ES 3.2 or more.
- Many comets and asteroids appear in the software in their true shape.
- Displays the DSS (Digitized Sky Survey) digitized sky in various wavelengths.
- Add interplanetary missions.

Visit https://winstars.net/en for more information about the software.

WinStars is a planetarium running on computers, tablets and mobiles. It is a 3D simulator that accurately represents celestial objects at a given time. It also allows you to travel in our galaxy and its close neighbourhood. A thread dedicated to scientific news allows you to follow and display in the software the results of research currently conducted in astrophysics. WinStars is a software in constant evolution. New functions are regularly added to make it an educational tool dedicated to the discovery of our Universe.The full version costs 3,99 EUR and gives access to all the features.

It is recommended to consult the documentation available at this address: https://winstars.net/docs/en

Main features:

- Visualise the sky as it was 500 years ago or as it will be in 10,000 years!
- Discover the names of the main stars or locate the constellations by moving your mobile. WinStars will help you to identify the objects you are pointing at.
- Are you looking for an object? Just type its name and let the software guide you.
- WinStars gives you access to a lot of information about each object.
- The software includes a huge database of billions of objects.
- Each object has a detailed card which is updated in real time (distances, right ascension, declination, azimuth, altitude and magnitude).

- Track planetary missions (Voyager 2, Pioneer 10, etc.).

- Customisable landscapes.

- Plots the celestial equator, the ecliptic, the azimuthal and equatorial coordinate grids.
- Represents the orbits of the planets in 3D.
- A night mode allowing you to watch the screen in the dark without being dazzled.
- Easy installation of additional modules.
- Automated software updates.
- Customisable landscapes.
- Available languages: bulgarian, english, french, german, russian, spanish

The free version offers most of the functions available, but the acquisition of a licence provides an additional enhancement to the software:

- Add the Gaia EDR3 catalogue containing 1.7 billion stars... up to the magnitude 22 ! (internet connection required).
- Add many deep sky objects (more than 100000 galaxies, nebulae, clusters, pulsars, quasars)
- Explore the stars close to our Sun.
- Leave the Milky Way and visit other galaxies. Discover the large-scale structures of our Universe.
- Planetary surfaces rendered in 3D with improved textures. Fly over mountains and lunar craters or walk on the surface of the Earth, Moon or Mars ! Please note that your device must be compatible with OpenGL ES 3.2 or more.
- Many comets and asteroids appear in the software in their true shape.
- Displays the DSS (Digitized Sky Survey) digitized sky in various wavelengths.
- Add interplanetary missions.

Visit https://winstars.net/en for more information about the software.

A thread dedicated to scientific news allows you to follow and display in the software the results of research currently conducted in astrophysics. WinStars is a software in constant evolution. New functions are regularly added to make it an educational tool dedicated to the discovery of our Universe.The full version costs 3,99 EUR and gives access to all the features.

It is recommended to consult the documentation available at this address: https://winstars.net/docs/en

Main features:

- Visualise the sky as it was 500 years ago or as it will be in 10,000 years!
- Discover the names of the main stars or locate the constellations by moving your mobile. WinStars will help you to identify the objects you are pointing at.
- Are you looking for an object? Just type its name and let the software guide you.
- WinStars gives you access to a lot of information about each object.
- The software includes a huge database of billions of objects.
- Each object has a detailed card which is updated in real time (distances, right ascension, declination, azimuth, altitude and magnitude).
- It is possible to track all satellites placed in orbit around the Earth and predict, for example, the times of visibility of the International Space Station (ISS).
- Represents with precision the position of the main satellites of Mars, Jupiter, Saturn, Uranus and Neptune. All you need to do is zooming in sufficiently on the main planet.
- Also calculates the position of hundreds of thousands of additional objects in our solar system (comets and asteroids).
- Track planetary missions (Voyager 2, Pioneer 10, etc.).
- Indicates the significant astronomical phenomenons visible from your observation location.
- Plots the celestial equator, the ecliptic, the azimuthal and equatorial coordinate grids.
- Represents the orbits of the planets in 3D.
- A night mode allowing you to watch the screen in the dark without being dazzled.
- Easy installation of additional modules.
- Automated software updates.
- Customisable landscapes.
- Available languages: bulgarian, english, french, german, russian, spanish

The free version offers most of the functions available, but the acquisition of a licence provides an additional enhancement to the software:

- Add the Gaia EDR3 catalogue containing 1.7 billion stars... up to the magnitude 22 ! (internet connection required).
- Add many deep sky objects (more than 100000 galaxies, nebulae, clusters, pulsars, quasars)
- Explore the stars close to our Sun.
- Leave the Milky Way and visit other galaxies. Discover the large-scale structures of our Universe.
- Planetary surfaces rendered in 3D with improved textures. Fly over mountains and lunar craters or walk on the surface of the Earth, Moon or Mars ! Please note that your device must be compatible with OpenGL ES 3.2 or more.
- Many comets and asteroids appear in the software in their true shape.
- Displays the DSS (Digitized Sky Survey) digitized sky in various wavelengths.
- Add interplanetary missions.

Visit https://winstars.net/en for more information about the software.
descriptionShort: The whole universe in your pocket !

- Access the astronomical news by clicking on the i symbols that now appear on the maps.
- Introduction of all known exoplanets.

All revisions : https://winstars.net/en/changelog

WinStars is always faster and easier to use. If you have any comments or suggestions, I would be happy to hear you: franck.richard@winstars.net

title: WinStars 3 - Astronomy

container.value:
Belacqua labo
155 rue de l'hôpital
Doué-La-Fontaine
49700 Doué-En-Anjou
France

creator: Franck RICHARD
descriptionHtml:
WinStars is a multi-platform 3D planetarium that accurately represents celestial objects at a given moment. It also allows you to virtually travel through our solar system, the Milky Way, and the nearest galaxy clusters. Additionally, a dedicated news feed keeps you up-to-date with the latest discoveries in astrophysics, which can be visualized within the software. WinStars is a constantly evolving software, with new features regularly added to make it a tool dedicated to the exploration of our Universe.

It is recommended to consult the documentation available at this address: https://winstars.net/docs/en

Main features:

- Visualize the sky as it was 500 years ago or as it will be in 10,000 years! Discover the names of the main stars or locate constellations by moving your mobile. WinStars helps you identify the objects you point at.
- Looking for an object? Type its name and let the software guide you.
- WinStars gives you access to a vast database of information about each object.
- The software includes a massive database of billions of objects. Each object has a detailed card updated in real-time, including distances, right ascension, declination, azimuth, altitude, and magnitude.
- Track all satellites orbiting the Earth and predict the International Space Station (ISS)’s visibility times, for example.
- It accurately represents the position of the main satellites of Mars, Jupiter, Saturn, Uranus, and Neptune, with zooming on the main planet.
- It also calculates the position of hundreds of thousands of additional objects in our solar system, such as comets and asteroids.
- Track planetary missions like Voyager 2, Pioneer 10, etc.
- Locate all known exoplanets.
- Indicate significant astronomical phenomena visible from your observation location.
- Plot the celestial equator, the ecliptic, and the azimuthal and equatorial coordinate grids.
- Represent the orbits of planets in 3D.
- A night mode enables watching the screen in the dark without being dazzled.
- Customisable landscapes.
- It offers easy installation of additional modules and automated software updates.
- The software is available in Bulgarian, English, French, German, Russian, and Spanish.

While the free version offers most functions available, acquiring a license provides additional enhancements to the software, including:

- Adding the Gaia EDR3 catalogue, containing 1.7 billion stars up to magnitude 22! (Internet connection required)
- Adding more than 100,000 galaxies, nebulae, clusters, pulsars, quasars, and other deep sky objects.
- Exploring the stars close to our Sun and leaving the Milky Way to visit other galaxies. Discover the large-scale structures of our Universe.
- 3D-rendered planetary surfaces with improved textures. Fly over mountains and lunar craters or walk on the surface of the Earth, Moon, or Mars! Please note that your device must be compatible with OpenGL 4.1 (or OpenGL ES 3.2 for mobiles).
- Displaying many comets and asteroids in their true shape.
- Displaying the Digitized Sky Survey (DSS) in various wavelengths.
- Unlocking better textures for landscape, sky background, etc. on Android & iOS.
- Offering more interplanetary missions.

Visit https://winstars.net/en for more information about the software.
descriptionShort: The whole universe in your pocket !

- Looking for an object? Type its name and let the software guide you.
- WinStars gives you access to a vast database of information about each object.
- The software includes a massive database of billions of objects. Each object has a detailed card updated in real-time, including distances, right ascension, declination, azimuth, altitude, and magnitude.
- Track all satellites orbiting the Earth and predict the International Space Station (ISS)’s visibility times, for example.
- It accurately represents the position of the main satellites of Mars, Jupiter, Saturn, Uranus, and Neptune, with zooming on the main planet.
- It also calculates the position of hundreds of thousands of additional objects in our solar system, such as comets and asteroids.
- Track planetary missions like Voyager 2, Pioneer 10, etc.
- Locate all known exoplanets.
- Indicate significant astronomical phenomena visible from your observation location.
- Plot the celestial equator, the ecliptic, and the azimuthal and equatorial coordinate grids.
- Represent the orbits of planets in 3D.
- A night mode enables watching the screen in the dark without being dazzled.
- Customisable landscapes.
- It offers easy installation of additional modules and automated software updates.
- The software is available in Bulgarian, English, French, German, Russian, and Spanish.

While the free version offers most functions available, acquiring a license provides additional enhancements to the software, including:

- Adding the Gaia EDR3 catalogue, containing 1.7 billion stars up to magnitude 22! (Internet connection required)
- Adding more than 100,000 galaxies, nebulae, clusters, pulsars, quasars, and other deep sky objects.
- Exploring the stars close to our Sun and leaving the Milky Way to visit other galaxies. Discover the large-scale structures of our Universe.
- 3D-rendered planetary surfaces with improved textures. Fly over mountains and lunar craters or walk on the surface of the Earth, Moon, or Mars! Please note that your device must be compatible with OpenGL 4.1 (or OpenGL ES 3.2 for mobiles).
- Displaying many comets and asteroids in their true shape.
- Displaying the Digitized Sky Survey (DSS) in various wavelengths.
- Unlocking better textures for landscape, sky background, etc. on Android & iOS.
- Offering more interplanetary missions.

Visit https://winstars.net/en for more information about the software.

- The software includes a massive database of billions of objects. Each object has a detailed card updated in real-time, including distances, right ascension, declination, azimuth, altitude, and magnitude.
- Track all satellites orbiting the Earth and predict the International Space Station (ISS)’s visibility times, for example.
- It accurately represents the position of the main satellites of Mars, Jupiter, Saturn, Uranus, and Neptune, with zooming on the main planet.
- It also calculates the position of hundreds of thousands of additional objects in our solar system, such as comets and asteroids.
- Track planetary missions like Voyager 2, Pioneer 10, etc.
- Locate all known exoplanets.
- Indicate significant astronomical phenomena visible from your observation location.
- Plot the celestial equator, the ecliptic, and the azimuthal and equatorial coordinate grids.
- Represent the orbits of planets in 3D.
- A night mode enables watching the screen in the dark without being dazzled.
- Customisable landscapes.
- It offers easy installation of additional modules and automated software updates.
- The software is available in Bulgarian, English, French, German, Russian, and Spanish.

Other available features :

- Adding the Gaia EDR3 catalogue, containing 1.7 billion stars up to magnitude 22! (Internet connection required)
- Adding more than 100,000 galaxies, nebulae, clusters, pulsars, quasars, and other deep sky objects.
- Exploring the stars close to our Sun and leaving the Milky Way to visit other galaxies. Discover the large-scale structures of our Universe.
- 3D-rendered planetary surfaces with improved textures. Fly over mountains and lunar craters or walk on the surface of the Earth, Moon, or Mars! Please note that your device must be compatible with OpenGL 4.1 (or OpenGL ES 3.2 for mobiles).
- Displaying many comets and asteroids in their true shape.
- Displaying the Digitized Sky Survey (DSS) in various wavelengths.
- Unlocking better textures for landscape, sky background, etc. on Android & iOS.
- Offering more interplanetary missions.

Visit https://winstars.net/en for more information about the software.
